newsitem.title: OMAN: Oman Sultan Qaboos to attend Gulf summit in Doha.
newsitem.headline: Oman Sultan Qaboos to attend Gulf summit in Doha.

text.p: Oman's Sultan Qaboos bin Said will attend this week's summit of the six-member Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) in Doha, a statement from the royal Omani court said on Thursday.
"Sultan Qaboos bin Said will attend the GCC summit to be held in Doha from December 7 to 9. This is in line with the continual brotherly relations between GCC member states," the statement said.
The GCC, set up in 1981, is made up of Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, Bahrain, Qatar, Oman and the United Arab Emirates.

Bahrain, locked in a territorial dispute with summit host Qatar, is boycotting the summit. Neither King Fahd of Saudi Arabia, the GCC's dominant power, nor UAE President Sheikh Zaid bin Sultan al-Nahayan is expected to attend for health reasons.
